intro: Gastridium lendigerum var. longiaristatum, commonly known as the long-stalked gastridium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique growth habit.
